intro: Capsella tenella, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring small, oval-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. Its flowers are bright yellow, arranged in clusters, and are followed by small, round pods that contain several seeds. Capsella tenella is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and fields.
